# project-quickstart

Quick project setup with agents and tasks

## Trigger

This workflow is triggered on manual.

---

This is a GitHub Agentic Workflow. It describes automation goals in natural language.
The AI agent figures out how to execute it.

## Workflow Goals

This workflow manages the following stages:


### Stage 1: SetupProject

Initializeprojectstructure

**Action:** create
**Arguments:** {project_name},--type,{project_type}

**Action:** add
**Arguments:** {project_name}-start,#{project_name}project,-t,project

### Stage 2: Development

Developtheapplication

**Action:** add
**Arguments:** Implementcorefeaturesfor{project_name},-p,high

**Action:** create
**Arguments:** {project_name}-agent,--template,code

### Stage 3: Testing

Testandvalidate

**Action:** add
**Arguments:** {project_name}-test,pytesttests/,-t,test

### Stage 4: Deployment

Deploytoproduction

**Action:** done
**Arguments:** {task_id}


## Tool Mapping

This workflow uses the following flow tools:

| Flow Tool | GitHub Equivalent |
|-----------|------------------|
| prj create | Create new repository/files |
| agt create | Create agent repository structure |
| tick add | Create GitHub issue |
| snip add | Add to project wiki or documentation |
| crw run | Execute agent workflow in GitHub Actions |

## Running this Workflow

To compile this workflow into a GitHub Actions workflow:

```bash
gh aw compile project-quickstart.md
```

This generates a standard GitHub Actions YAML file that can be committed to the repository.
